name: Lithuania
description: Lithuania, a Baltic nation nestled in Northeastern Europe, boasts a rich history, stunning landscapes, and a unique cultural heritage. Characterized by vast plains, dense forests, and a dramatic coastline along the Baltic Sea, Lithuania offers a diverse range of experiences for travelers and nature enthusiasts. From medieval castles and charming towns to expansive national parks and serene lakes, Lithuania is a country of contrasts and captivating beauty.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
quickFacts.detail: Vilnius is renowned for its Baroque architecture, lively arts scene, and delicious cuisine.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Relatively small, but packed with diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: Lithuania's territory includes plains, forests, and coastal areas.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A welcoming and historically resilient population.
quickFacts.detail: Lithuanians are known for their hospitality and strong cultural traditions.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: A Baltic language with a unique history.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Lithuania's economy is transitioning towards a more diversified model.

climateData.title: Lithuanian Climate
climateData.description: Lithuania experiences a temperate climate with warm summers and cold winters. The coastal areas are moderated by the Baltic Sea, resulting in milder temperatures compared to inland regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A time of renewal and blossoming, with temperatures gradually rising.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny days, ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spectacular fall foliage and cooler temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and snowy winters, with occasional blizzards.

naturalWonders.name: Curonian Spit
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, the Curonian Spit is a stunning sand dune peninsula stretching along the Baltic Sea. Formed by centuries of wind and waves, it boasts unique ecosystems, traditional wooden villages, and breathtaking views.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The spit is a narrow strip of land separating the Curonian Lagoon from the Baltic Sea. It's a haven for diverse birdlife and features shifting sand dunes, pine forests, and picturesque fishing villages like Nida and Juodkrantė. The area is constantly evolving due to the relentless forces of nature.
viewingTips: Wear sturdy shoes for walking on the dunes

naturalWonders.name: Aukštaitija National Park
naturalWonders.description: A vast expanse of pristine forests, serene lakes, and meandering rivers, Aukštaitija National Park offers a tranquil escape into nature.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This park is characterized by its numerous lakes, including Lake Spaude, one of the deepest lakes in Eastern Europe. It's a haven for wildlife, with diverse flora and fauna, including rare bird species. Hiking trails wind through the forests, offering stunning views and opportunities for exploration.

ecosystemData.title: Lithuanian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Lithuania's ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from coastal wetlands to vast forests and peat bogs. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, contributing significantly to the country's biodiversity.
